scan_linter_check.description: The gs.log() statement can be used to write information to the system log. It is generally used when debugging. Using gs.log() statements will pollute the system log. Prior to promoting artifacts to a production instance, debugging statement should - in most cases - be removed.
scan_linter_check.name: Scripts should not contain gs.log statements
scan_linter_check.resolution_details: The best practice is to remove debug statements from scripts or making them conditionally controlled by a property.
scan_linter_check.short_description: Scripts should not contain gs.log statements
scan_linter_check.sys_name: Scripts should not contain gs.log statements
